com.bmwcarit.barefoot.spatial

Class Intersect

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bmwcarit.barefoot.spatial.Intersect

  • public class Intersect
extends Object
    Geodesic intersection.

    Note: Intersect.java has been ported to Java from its C++ equivalent Intersect.cpp, authored by C. F. F. Karney and licensed under MIT/X11 license. The following documentation is mostly the same as for its C++ equivalent, but has been adopted to apply to this Java implementation.

    Simple solution to the intersection problem using the gnomonic projection: The intersectio problem is, given two geodesics a and b, determine the point of intersection of a and b. The gnomonic projection and the solution to the intersection problem are derived in Section 8 of

    • C. F. F. Karney, Algorithms for geodesics, J. Geodesy 87, 43--55 (2013); DOI: 10.1007/s00190-012-0578-z; addenda: geod-addenda.html.

    In gnomonic projection geodesics are nearly straight; and they are exactly straight if they go through the center of projection. The intersection can then be found as follows: Guess an intersection point. Project the two line segments into gnomonic, compute their intersection in this projection, use this intersection point as the new center, and repeat.

    CAUTION: The solution to the intersection problem is valid only under the following conditions:

    • The two points defining the geodesic and the point of interception must be in the same hemisphere centered at the intersection point for the gnomonic projection to be defined.

    • Field Detail

      • maxit

        public static int maxit
        Maximum number of iterations for calculation of interception point. (The solution should usually converge before reaching the maximum number of iterations. The default is 10.)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Intersect

        public Intersect(net.sf.geographiclib.Geodesic earth)
        Constructor for Intersect.

        Parameters:
        earth - the Geodesic object to use for geodesic calculations. By default the WGS84 ellipsoid should be used.

    • Method Detail

      • intersect

        public net.sf.geographiclib.GeodesicData intersect(double lata1,
                                                   double lona1,
                                                   double lata2,
                                                   double lona2,
                                                   double latb1,
                                                   double lonb1,
                                                   double latb2,
                                                   double lonb2)
        Intersection of geodesics.

        Parameters:
        lata1 - latitude of point 1 of geodesic a (degrees).
        lona1 - longitude of point 1 of geodesic a (degrees).
        lata2 - latitude of point 2 of geodesic a (degrees).
        lona2 - longitude of point 2 of geodesic a (degrees).
        latb1 - latitude of point 1 of geodesic b (degrees).
        lonb1 - longitude of point 1 of geodesic b (degrees).
        latb2 - latitude of point 2 of geodesic b (degrees).
        lonb2 - longitude of point 2 of geodesic b (degrees).
        Returns:
        a GeodesicData object, defining a geodesic from point 1 of geodesic a to the intersection point, with the following fields: lat1, lon1, azi1, lat2, lon2, azi2, s12, a12.

        lat1 should be in the range [−90°, 90°]; lon1 and azi1 should be in the range [−540°, 540°). The values of lon2 and azi2 returned are in the range [−180°, 180°).
